contents: Article 7 (Member Organizations) ① Sports organizations become member organizations by joining the Sports Association as members. ② The types of member organizations in Paragraph 1 are as follows., 1. Member sports organizations refer to organizations established for the purpose of activities and business of specific sports among member organizations., 2. Member city/provincial sports associations are among member organizations. Refers to a sports association established with the approval of the head of the competent special city, metropolitan city, special self-governing city, province, or special self-governing province pursuant to Article 33-2 of the National Sports Promotion Act. ③ The classification of member organizations in Paragraph 1 is as follows., 1. Regular member organization refers to an organization that has confirmed its membership through a resolution of the Board of Directors of the Sports Association and a resolution of the General Meeting of Representatives (hereinafter referred to as *General Meeting). 2. Associate member organization refers to an organization whose membership has been confirmed through a resolution by the Sports Association Board of Directors. 3. A recognized organization refers to an organization whose representativeness is only temporarily recognized by resolution of the Board of Directors of the Sports Association and whose rights and obligations are not applied. ④ The Sports Council may change the classification of member organizations in accordance with the procedures stipulated in these Articles of Incorporation. can., ⑤ The qualification requirements for members according to the classification in paragraph 3 shall be determined separately in consideration of the size and function of the sports organization.
